cabinet.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government
cabinet.translation[0].definitions[0].no: Cabinet can be followed by a singular or a plural verb
The cabinet has been discussing the plans
The cabinet have been discussing the plans
cabinet.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a piece of furniture with doors and shelves or drawers, used for storing or showing things
cabinet.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: cabinet + NOUN
a cabinet meeting
A cabinet meeting will consider the government's environmental policies.
a cabinet member/a member of the cabinet
Two senior cabinet members have resigned.
a cabinet minister
Cabinet ministers voted against the proposal.
a cabinet reshuffle
Putin promoted his Defence Minister in a surprising cabinet reshuffle.
a cabinet post
She accepted a cabinet post with the new Conservative government.
appoint a cabinet
The prime minister appoints the cabinet.
form a cabinet
Ministers remain in office until a new cabinet is formed.
join a cabinet
Lee was considered a likely candidate to join the cabinet.
the cabinet meets
The cabinet will meet again on April 30th.
the inner cabinet
He was a member of Howard's inner cabinet.
the full cabinet
There was a meeting of the full cabinet.
the shadow cabinet
He joined the shadow cabinet as transport spokesman.
cabinet.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the group of politicians, including the leader of the government, who hold important positions in the government and meet regularly to discuss important issues
cabinet.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: a law approved by the prime minister and his cabinet
Cabinet ministers were ordered to reduce the size of their offices.
